ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] gforce 2
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hmm.. I have a GEForce 2 MX 64. Not sure about the 32. The 64 works fine for me. ... my bro has geforce 3 and says it s awesome. I m pretty sure it s PCI.
ygData.messageBody:
> I have an Nvidia tnt2 64 graphics card. PCI. I have seen the gforce 2
> for about $45. I am wondering if I can expect much improved
> performance with the gforce 2. Both are pci, both 32k. I get lots of
> lag in Rivervale, most of Luclin, and some of the other cities. Not
> everywhere, just where lots of people gather and the backgrounds are
> graphics intensive.
>
Hmm.. I have a GEForce 2 MX 64. Not sure about the 32. The 64 works fine for
me.
>
> I don't have the money to go for the gforce 3, and I don't even know
> if the 3 comes in pci format. I need another hard disk as well as
> doing a graphics upgrade, so the money needs to stay around that $45.
>
my bro has geforce 3 and says it's awesome. I'm pretty sure it's PCI. they
probably have for both PCI and AGP.
You might want to check www.pricegrabber.com to see if you can find a good
price. Compare that to www.pricewatch.com as well.
Oh, and if you want a product review, you can also try www.epinions.com
I found those 3 very useful in finding myself a new modem and sound card.
>
> I would want a very obvious improvement to even bother with the
> upgrade on the graphics.
>
I think one of those websites listed lets you compare two of the products...
so you can look for your current one and compare it with a potential card.
luv,
-Su
